subject: Gardening
title: Shalimar Bagh: Mughal Paradise
description: One-minute skill: Shalimar Bagh: Mughal Paradise.

hook.text: Emperor Jahangir called Kashmir 'paradise on Earth.' Then he built a garden there to prove it.

buildup.text: Shalimar Bagh was built in 1619 on the shores of Dal Lake, with terraces rising from the water's edge.

discovery.text: The garden descends through three terraces: public, private, and the emperor's exclusive zenana (women's garden).

twist.text: Water was the true protagonist. Over 400 fountains and cascading channels created constant soothing sound.

climax.text: Shalimar Bagh perfected the Mughal visionâ€”a walled paradise where architecture, water, and nature fuse into one.

punchline.text: Kashmir's paradise was built, not just discovered.

quiz.question: How was Shalimar Bagh structured across its three terraces?
options: Each terrace featured a different type of fruit tree
Terraces were organized as public, private, and the emperor's zenana
The three terraces represented past, present, and future
